page.title: 19GT.HOLLAND NATURE RESERVE
page.content: THE ESSEX NATURALIST TRUST HAVE TURNED THE OLD GRAVEL PITS, JUST OUTSIDE GREAT HOLLAND, INTO A NATURE RESERVE. EXPERTS FROM THE TRUST IDENTIFY SPECIES OF PLANTS AND ANIMALS AND PLOT THE INFORMATION ON CHARTS TO GIVE AN OVERALL PICTURE. ADDERS, GRASS SNAKES AND LIZARDS ARE PRESENT IN THE RESERVE. RARE PLANTS ARE ALSO FOUND THERE, EVEN THOSE THOUGHT TO BE EXTINCT. THE TRUST ISSUES ITS OWN MAGAZINE CALLED 'WATCH'. ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP COSTS Â£2.00. OPEN DAYS ARE HELD ONCE A YEAR WHEN THE PUBLIC IS INVITED TO SEE THE WORK OF THE TRUST. THE AIM OF THE TRUST IS TO PRESERVE NATURAL HABITATS AND TO PROMOTE INTEREST IN THE CONSERVATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT.
